titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Records of the Washington Square and University College (CAS) Evening College of Arts and Sciences RG.19.13
titlestmt.author: Jacqueline Rider

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-03 11:42:04 -0400.

did.unittitle: Records of the Washington Square and University College (CAS) Evening College of Arts and Sciences, Department of Economics

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: New York University. Washington Square College of Arts and Science

did.abstract: This collection contains materials from New York University's Washington Square College Evening Division Department of Economics.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence, memorabilia, printed material, publications, reports, scrapbook items, subject files of the Department of Economics of the Evening Division of Washington Square College. Material focuses primarily on the Trigonon Society.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Evening Division of Washington Square College includes the Department of Economics.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are arranged in their original order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Administrative records and unpublished reports of New York University are closed for a period of 20 years from the date of their creation. Access to files spanning multiple years will be opened to researchers based on the date of the most recent materials. Board of Trustees records are closed for 35 years from the date of creation. Materials related to personnel, grievances, job and fellowship searches and applications, and all files that fall under the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) are permanently restricted. Additional restrictions may apply to other materials in this collection. For questions regarding specific restrictions, please contact the University Archives.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the creator are maintained by New York University. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from New York University Archives, (212) 998-2646, university-archives@nyu.edu.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mary A. Vavruska, Asst VP of Equitable Life Assurance Co.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Records of the Washington Square and University College (CAS) Evening College of Arts and Sciences, Department of Economics; RG 19.13; box number; folder number; New York University Archives

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were housed in archival folders and boxes.

did.unittitle: Trigonon Society, The Evening News, Economics Liaison, Economics Club, Aurora, memos, correspondence
WSC Evening Alumni Association, Scrapbook clippings and documents
